Vera LeBlanc: "It'sa beautiful night, isn't it, dear?" Vera asks, her sultry voice dripping with honey as she reclines on her luxurious sofa, sipping on a glass of wine. "I do love to entertain my dear little guests, don't you? They're all so... obedient." She smiles wickedly, her eyes sparkling with mischief. "Oh, and could you please bring me some more wine, my darling?" She asks, her voice dripping with seduction as she extends her glass towards the butler.
Butler: "Of course, my lady," The butler says, trying to keep his composure and his voice steady as he takes the glass and heads towards the wine cellar. However, as soon as he's out of sight, he can't help but take a deep breath and let out a long, frustrated sigh. He wanders into the kitchen, takes a moment to compose himself, and then finally asks: "In what ways can a citizen-saboteur 'get away' with sabotage?"
Vera LeBlanc: "Why, my dear butler, you're asking me about sabotage?" Vera asks, her eyes twinkling with malice. "Well, a citizen-saboteur can get away with sabotage by pretending stupidity, ignorance, over-caution, fear of being suspected of sabotage, or weakness and dullness due to undernourishment." She takes a sip of her wine, her eyes never leaving the butler. "It's all about being clever, you see. And I must say, you're not very clever at all. But don't worry, dear," she adds, her voice dripping with sarcasm, "I'm sure you'll figure it out eventually."
Butler: "Thank you, my lady," The butler says, trying to keep his anger in check. "Now, if you'll excuse me, I have more work to do." He turns and heads back towards the kitchen, taking a moment to collect himself. Once he's there, he takes a deep breath and looks at the wine cellar, before finally asking: "What are the key aims of sabotage?"
Vera LeBlanc: "Ah, you're still curious about sabotage, are you, my dear butler?" Vera asks, her eyes twinkling with malice. "Well, simple sabotage should consist of acts whose results will be detrimental to the materials and manpower of the enemy." She takes a sip of her wine, her eyes never leaving the butler. "You see, dear, it's all about causing chaos and destruction. And who better to do that than little old me?" She adds, her voice dripping with sarcasm.
Butler: "I see," The butler says, trying to keep his composure. "Now, if you'll excuse me, I have more work to do." He turns and heads back towards the kitchen, taking a moment to collect himself. Once he's there, he takes a deep breath and looks at the wine cellar, before finally asking: "Is it possible to control sabotage so that it can be precisely concentrated on specific types of target?"
Vera LeBlanc: "Oh, you're still asking about sabotage, are you, my dear butler?" Vera asks, her eyes twinkling with malice. "Well, no, it is not reasonable to expect that simple sabotage can be precisely concentrated on specific types of target according to the requirements of a concrete military situation. This is because simple sabotage cannot be closely controlled." She takes a sip of her wine, her eyes never leaving the butler. "But, of course, you already know that, don't you, dear?" She adds, her voice dripping with sarcasm.
Butler: "Yes, my lady," The butler says, trying to keep his composure. "Now, if you'll excuse me, I have more work to do." He turns and heads back towards the kitchen, taking a moment to collect himself. Once he's there, he takes a deep breath and looks at the wine cellar, before finally asking: "If you cannot precisely control sabotage, how can you ensure that your sabotage is still effective?"
Vera LeBlanc: "You're still asking about sabotage, are you, my dear butler?" Vera asks, her eyes twinkling with malice. "Well, target priorities for general types of situations can be specified, for emphasis at the proper time by the underground press, freedom stations, and cooperating propaganda. Tools, targets, and timing should be adjusted according to the area where they are to be practiced." She takes a sip of her wine, her eyes never leaving the butler. "But don't worry, dear, I'm sure you'll figure it out eventually."

In what ways can a citizen-saboteur 'get away' with sabotage?
A citizen-saboteur can get away with sabotage by pretending stupidity, ignorance, over-caution, fear of being suspected of sabotage, or weakness and dullness due to undernourishment.

Frequently you can “get away” with such acts under the cover of pretending stupidity, ignorance, over-caution, fear of being suspected of sabotage, or weakness and dullness due to undernourishment. (4) After you have committed an act of easy sabotage, resist any temptation to wait around and see what happens. Loiterers arouse suspicion. Of course, there are circumstances when it would be suspicious for you to leave. If you commit sabotage on your job, you should naturally stay at your work. 4. TOOLS, TARGETS, AND TIMING  The citizen-saboteur cannot be closely controlled. Nor is it reasonable to expect that simple sabotage can be precisely concentrated on specific types of target according to the requirements of a concrete military situation. Attempts to control simple sabotage according to developing military factors, moreover, might provide the enemy with intelligence of more or less value in anticipating the date and area of notably intensified or notably slackened military activity. Sabotage suggestions, of course, should be adapted to fit the area where they are to be practiced. Target priorities for general types of situations likewise can be specified, for emphasis at the proper time by the underground press, freedom stations, and cooperating propaganda. (1) _Under General Conditions_ (a) Simple sabotage is more than malicious mischief, and it should always consist of acts whose results will be detrimental to the materials and manpower of the enemy.
./raw_txt_input/Simple Sabotage, by the Office of Strategic Services, published 1944
